qas.question: Where is the ball placed when a defensive penalty is committed in their own end zone?
In which North American style of football is the line of scrimmage never inside the one-yard line?
A play that results in what outcome will never also be a scoring play?
How many penalty yards are awarded when the ball is nearer the goal line than the usual penalty yardage?

answers.text: half the distance to the goal line

qas.question: Who do touchdowns never result in a score for?
When the defense commits penalty yardage in their end zone what happens?

plausible_answers.text: half the distance to the goal line

qas.question: How many penalty yards are given when the ball is nearer the first down than the usual penalty yardage?
What infraction  in the end zone advances the ball half the distance to the goal with an automatic first down?
In American football what can't start inside either one yard line?

context: <a2_0>Penalties<a2_0/> never result in a score for <b4_0>the offence<b4_0/>. For example, <b7_0>a point-of-foul infraction<b7_0/> committed by the defence in their end zone is <b5_0>not ruled a touchdown<b5_0/>, but instead advances the ball to the <a0_0>one-yard line<a0_0/> with an automatic first down. For a distance penalty, if the yardage is greater than <b6_0>half the distance to the goal line<b6_0/>, then the ball is advanced <a3_0>half the distance to the goal line<a3_0/>, though only up to the one-yard line (unlike American football, in <a1_0>Canadian<a1_0/> football no <b8_0>scrimmage<b8_0/> may start inside either one-yard line). If the original penalty yardage would have resulted in a first down or moving the ball past the goal line, a first down is awarded.
